question: Match the following (Algae):
columnA: Aquatic organisms with pigments and stored food
Gametes showing isogamy, anisogamy or oogamy
matches: Chlorophyll-bearing simple, thalloid, autotrophic organisms – Algae
Aquatic organisms with pigments and stored food – Algae
Three classes of algae – Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae and Rhodophyceae
Modes of reproduction in algae – Vegetative, asexual, sexual
Gametes showing isogamy, anisogamy or oogamy – Sexual reproduction in algae
answer: Chlorophyll-bearing simple, thalloid, autotrophic organisms – Algae, Aquatic organisms with pigments and stored food – Algae, Three classes of algae – Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae and Rhodophyceae, Modes of reproduction in algae – Vegetative, asexual, sexual, Gametes showing isogamy, anisogamy or oogamy – Sexual reproduction in algae

question: Match the following (Bryophytes):
columnA: Plants that live in soil but depend on water for sexual reproduction
columnB: Upright, slender axes with spirally arranged leaves
matches: Plants that live in soil but depend on water for sexual reproduction – Bryophytes
Attachment structure in bryophytes – Rhizoids
Division of bryophytes – Liverworts and mosses
Plant body of liverworts – Thalloid and dorsiventral
Plant body of mosses – Upright, slender axes with spirally arranged leaves
answer: Plants that live in soil but depend on water for sexual reproduction – Bryophytes, Attachment structure in bryophytes – Rhizoids, Division of bryophytes – Liverworts and mosses, Plant body of liverworts – Thalloid and dorsiventral, Plant body of mosses – Upright, slender axes with spirally arranged leaves

question: Match the following (Bryophytes - gametophyte & sporophyte):
columnA: Fusion of gametes in bryophytes forms
matches: Main plant body in bryophytes – Gametophyte
Male sex organ in bryophytes – Antheridia
Female sex organ in bryophytes – Archegonia
Fusion of gametes in bryophytes forms – Zygote
Sporophyte produces – Haploid spores
answer: Main plant body in bryophytes – Gametophyte, Male sex organ in bryophytes – Antheridia, Female sex organ in bryophytes – Archegonia, Fusion of gametes in bryophytes forms – Zygote, Sporophyte produces – Haploid spores

question: Match the following (Pteridophytes):
matches: Main plant body in pteridophytes – Sporophyte
Sporophyte differentiated into – Root, stem and leaves
Organs with vascular tissues – True root, stem and leaves
Gametophytes of pteridophytes – Bear antheridia and archegonia
Requirement for male gamete transfer – Water
answer: Main plant body in pteridophytes – Sporophyte, Sporophyte differentiated into – Root, stem and leaves, Organs with vascular tissues – True root, stem and leaves, Gametophytes of pteridophytes – Bear antheridia and archegonia, Requirement for male gamete transfer – Water

question: Match the following (Gymnosperms - general features):
matches: Plants with naked ovules – Gymnosperms
Seeds after fertilisation remain – Exposed
Called naked-seeded plants – Gymnosperms
Sporophylls arranged spirally on axis – Microsporophylls and megasporophylls
Cones bearing microsporophylls and megasporophylls – Male and female cones
answer: Plants with naked ovules – Gymnosperms, Seeds after fertilisation remain – Exposed, Called naked-seeded plants – Gymnosperms, Sporophylls arranged spirally on axis – Microsporophylls and megasporophylls, Cones bearing microsporophylls and megasporophylls – Male and female cones

question: Match the following (Gymnosperms - fertilisation & seed):
matches: Pollen tube in gymnosperms releases – Male gamete
Fertilisation site – Egg cell in archegonia
After fertilisation, ovules develop into – Seeds
After fertilisation, zygote develops into – Embryo
Classes of angiosperms – Dicotyledons and monocotyledons
answer: Pollen tube in gymnosperms releases – Male gamete, Fertilisation site – Egg cell in archegonia, After fertilisation, ovules develop into – Seeds, After fertilisation, zygote develops into – Embryo, Classes of angiosperms – Dicotyledons and monocotyledons
